summary: In 1985, a Dublin teenager (Ferdia Walsh-Peelo) forms a rock 'n' roll band to win the heart of an aspiring model (Lucy Boynton).

reviews.content:
Was apprehensive at first, expecting some awful musical.
Loved the shots of Dublin and Synge Street where I spent 10 years. The Christian Brother was true to life, a prick.
More than pleasantly surprised. Great cast, great characters. Great story. Great music.
Loved it. 3 times and counting.
Really enjoyable movie with a great coming of age story and music only issue if small is the open ending.

Sing Street is an all-time favorite movie with one of the best soundtracks. A nostalgic, funny, heart-felt movie with deep, resonating punches that'll stay with you. A despairing movie about being a teenager in love, fighting systemic religious and social pressures, the importance of friendship, family and love. With a beautiful, happy ending. An incredibly moving present all wrapped up in a perfect bow. People who don't like this don't have taste.
I love this movie! The music in this is great!

For Brothers Everywhere.

First and foremost, the music in this movie is genius (and quirky). I have been listening to the album on repeat after finishing this movie a week ago. Sing Street is perfectly described by using Raphina's words: "happy-sad". I cried a bit, smiled a lot and enjoyed every minute, even the painful ones.

Though a love story on paper, the purest relationship is between the brothers. The respect they have for each other and how they comfort one another is one of the best parts of the film. All culminating in a beautiful finale, the love the brothers have for each other is palpable.

Some of the characters were underdeveloped and storylines were buttoned up too quickly, but the movie hits all the feels. We are meant to create and grow, and Sing Street illustrates that message beautifully. This is one of those movies that gets better after each viewing.

Best Character: Brendan
Best Scene: Writing "Up"
Best Quote: "Will you help me right a song?" - Conor. "Always." - Eamon.
Best Song: "Drive It Like You Stole It"

This movie was an instant classic for me. I am a fan of movies about music, not musicals, but films about bands/musicians (Whiplash, La Bamba, The Doors, Walk the Line, etc.) This one nails it on every level: Great story, great music, likeable characters and good humor. I watched it for the third time the other night with my girlfriend and it still shines bright. Highly recommended
Probably my favourite movie of all time. Honestly, it's priceless! God bless the Irish!

Sing street is about a new boy who is attending a new school to cut down on expenses before this he had been going to private school but now, he is going to public school his family are very musical and all have their own talents singing, Playing instruments Etc. Conor Loler is the main character in the plot he attends a new school where he is presented with fighting shouting and a uncontrolled school system he makes friends and forms a band and he meets the girl of his life. The plot starts when he attends the school, he is presented with fighting pushing bullying and more he experiences this when somebody makes him dance in a room a bully known as "cool guy".  He then meets his new ginger friend who had also experienced it and decided to form a band, He met friends who played instruments and helped with the band, He gets a girl for his music video who he falls in love with and they become a great band together.

There are many good things about the film the character development the family' and how every character has a certain personality, Mr. Stricklin character is seen as a bully and everyone is scared of him even when he appearance he Is the only one of the staff that the students would listen to he sees all the fighting when they think he is not looking but does not take action, His character really helped develop Conor as a character he made him form a band because he was scare and motivated and that set the course of the movie, His family are struggling financially and the family never really could start a band but when condor attended the school it motivated him to, His brother was very motivated also but when he was born he was very jealous and his career fell from there.

Overall them movie is good it has a good character development a good plot a good setting and really sets the moment of 1990 I would recommend this to all ages I think, especially people who like romantic comedy movies and music.

Star rating overall, I would give 2 stars as I'm not into romantic movies but I think if I was it would be an enjoyable movie, I did like the "comedy" but overall, it wasn't enjoyable for
This is a really fun film with a great story.
Is one of the collest, and with the best 80s representations, i ever seen. So glamourised, in the good way. But i really dont like the end.
Fun story and fantastic music. Stays great with every watch.
Absolute Chav musical Kino
I LOVE THIS MOVIE!!!!

When it ended it left me with the feel of happiness, but also it was so beautiful it makes you sad, witch is the perfect ending. The rest of the film was also top tier with great performances, outstanding music, and a great story. It ends up being the best film of 2016 and one of the greatest films made to date. Rating A
Simply a beautiful movie with great music

It’s the 80’s in Ireland, hard times for a family unraveling from unemployment, depression, and divorce, but youthfulness forges through to see a light at the end of a tunnel.                                                          At first glance Raphina catches Conner Lawlor’s eye and he crosses the street to meet this beautiful aspiring model. Trying to impress her he forms a band recruiting social misfits from the new school where he was just enrolled. This coming of age film  is filled with some great music, comedy, and drama that leads you through this journey of young love and the desire to strive for a new and better life. A must see film.

This movie didn't get nearly the attention it deserved. It nails 80s nostalgia with a great soundtrack and spot-on period feel. Great soundtrack, performances, and uplifting but bittersweet tone. Do not miss!

A musical drama film in which a boy growing up in Ireland during the 1980s escapes his strained family life by starting a band to impress the mysterious girl he likes. Directed and written by John Carney, it takes its inspiration from the music and movies of the '80s and it is a heart-warming and romantic tale full of original and fun rock 'n' roll songs that will stay in our memory for a while. It also has a very satisfying and optimistic ending that inspires us to follow our own path and our heart.

Character driven film with a smart soundtrack that should inspire teens everywhere. The tone is not light and some rather dark themes are touched upon and yet, by the end of the film, one is left with an overwhelming sense of hope and beauty. All characters in the film are flawed and yet none is without nuance. Acting and directing are almost flawless. An absolute must watch.

5 out of 5 stars, absolutely poggers, 
better than brexit

I'm in the middle of my third watch, I believe, of this movie. As a movie, it's pretty much PERFECT. And I'm not a fan of musicals! The soundtrack is absolutely excellent. To put it into perspective, I saw this for the first time before I had Apple Music. In other words, when I was still buying albums. So, not a minute had passed when this movie ended (I watched it the first time on Netflix just past midnight on January 1st, 2017, I think it was), that I went into iTunes and bought the album. It's THAT good. Watch it; rewatch it; feel good about doing it because "Sing Street" is a complete indie jewel.
Overall its a pretty good film, but you need to appreciate 80s fashion and music to get the most out of it, and for me that's a step too far.
Pas terrible en fait, musique pas au niveau de Scott Pilgrim; scénario vraiment bébé et prévisible.

Es una película que se nos muestra bastante optimista incluso con momentos negativos en la trama de la película, con muy buenos personajes resaltando Jack Reynor y en general una película que te llega al corazón, aunque al ser tan optimista, creo que crearon un final muy feliz que se sale un tanto de la trama ya desarrollada

Ésta es una película sobre la realidad en contra de nuestros sueños; y la lucha por lo que uno cree necesario para ser feliz. La premisa es simple, un joven se siente atraído por una chica, y para impresionarla forma una banda de rock. 
La película funciona porque no pretende ser más que la premisa original, nunca intenta ser más de lo que realmente es. 
Los números musicales son muy buenos y son parte trascendental para el desarrollo de la historia, no solamente de relleno. 
El director John Carney nos muestra un Dublín duro, difícil tanto para los adolescentes cómo para los adultos que vivían ahí en 1985. 
Una película muy bien desarrollada, con un trabajo que muestra confianza en el guión, el elenco y su premisa.
Banda sonora original excelente y ambientación ochentosa muy bien lograda. Tranquilamente puede ocupar el podio de quienes aman la música.

Do you ever have one of those dreams in which you feel amazing, not only while dreaming, but also later on during the day? Well this movie is like that. It's magic, is like watching a dream, and it leaves you with happy feelings as well. Beautiful movie!
Tiene buena trama, canciones memorables y personajes carismáticos.
Sentiment excrement and hipster sanitary napkins. Makes a combination for some "enlightened" reviewer to gush like a 12 year old girl. Not me it was just more claptrap proving excrement is worldwide.
Good soundtrack, great energy, wonderful performances and put together in a way that vibes so well as a universal memory of teenage years.
The music was charming and the actors were great. It was truly something unique.
Esta película es fatal puede ser que la gente la ame no les entiendo es muy aburrida y el final es terrible
Surprising fun, feel-good movie. Great music, great time.
The story we know, but is so well told and well acted and, in a form of a musical with original songs (something we need nowadays), we can forgive the fault of being not-so original...

Sing Street is one of the most touching and fresh coming of age films in years. Though it is rather formulaic, mostly due to it being an homage to 80s film styles, it is a beautiful modern musical. It is from the writer/director of Once, another musical that must be seen. I highly recommend.
It's a 80's fresh thats warms your heart
Lovely film from the heart. Thoroughly enjoyed it and the music worked as well.
Fucking Aye mannnnnnn
Lovable leads and catchy songs make this a feel-good movie for the ages.

Sing street está dirigida y escrita por John Carney. Conor es un chico de 15 años que vive en Dublín, su familia está pasando por una etapa complicada. Debido a esto, debe de cambiar de escuela, en donde conoce a Raphina y a otras personas.
Escuche muchas cosas buenas sobre esta película, y al ver que estaba disponible en netflix no dude en ver qué tal estaba, y es muy buena. John Carney nos da muy buenos personajes como Raphina (Lucy Boynton) , Conor(Ferdia Walsh- Peelo) y Brendan (Jack Reynor ). Lucy Boynton era a la única a la que ubica por Bohemian Rhapsody en la que hace un buen trabajo, pero aquí muestra todo su potencial. Ferdia Walsh- Peelo y Jack Reynor también hacen un gran trabajo, y tienen mucha química como hermanos, Brendan es la "figura paterna" de Conor, es el que lo ayuda, el que escucha sus problemas, el que lo aconseja y por eso es que me gusto mucho su personaje y eso en gran parte es por el trabajo de Jack, al principio parecía que sería el típico estereotipo de hermano bully, pero no. De lo que más destaca esta película es por la música, es bastante buena y ayuda mucho a que la película se sienta ligera y amena. La dirección de John Carney es muy buena, combina el drama y la comedia perfectamente y al igual que la música. Los vestuarios son buenos, son llamativos al igual que el maquillaje. Mi única queja sobre esta película es qué hay algunos personajes que no aportan nada a la trama, solo están ahí porque necesitan a gente para su banda, y lo único que hacen es tocar, tienen muy poca participación. Sing street es una gran película por sus personajes con los que te puedes relacionar, por su gran música y por su historia, definitivamente recomendaría esta película.
Just like any John Carney's movie: a real story of love and passion with awesome music. Great acting, great direction and fantastic soundtrack.

Reviewed 6.8.19  A teen movie with a positive message about the power of creativity, and the importance of following your dreams, no matter how scary that path may seem.  It isn't doing anything new and you can predict every plot twist.  But the characters are likable, and their exuberance is contagious.  Set in Ireland, in 1985, it nails the music and style of the time period.  Cosmo (Ferdia Walsh-Peelo) is a 15-year old boy dealing with family fall out and the recessive economic period in Irish history.  Along comes a muse, in the form of wanna-be model Raphina (Lucy Boynton).  Together with a rag-tag group of kids, they create a possible escape from it all, with music in the lead.  Supporting actor Jack Reynor delivers a crucial assist with a stellar performance as Brendan, Cosmo's brother born into missed opportunity.  With youthful enthusiasm, young love, and a brotherly hand, almost anything seems possible.

My favorite all time movie. The music is incredible but not too incredible to make it unbelievable. Relatable to people that lived in the 80s or young people. Best achievement of the message to follow your dreams out of any movie.
Just an all round great movie.
A feel good, happy, exciting, and entertaining look at escapism and the way music can help you break free of your own personal boundaries, Sing Street succeeds in all of these things and more.
Every man has a Raphina tuck away somewhere in their hearts.  "Love, is happy sad."  A Must See!
One of the very best films I've ever seen.
Absolutely love this film, would recommend to all ages
Heartwarming and touching movie. Catchy 80s inspired pop songs.
Great movie in every way!  You fall in love with the characters even the bully! Great music too!  Funny, sad, heartbreaking all at once.  Beautifully done.
